review: 5 Stars for doing exactly what it said it did. Took a minute to pair with Wi-Fi, but runs very smoothly and pretty fast for a stick. Wish they had HBOgo app.
author: norma murdoch-kitt

review: Unboxed, 20 mins of software updates. Then to go setup services, now the Stick wants me to type in a bunch or more complex passwords using...wait for it...the six button TV remote.  Ain't nobody got time for that.  I should be able to tie accounts to my stick via my Amazon account, use a browser to connect directly to the Stick and setup accounts, or use the way the Wii authorizes Netflix: with a code in real web browser.  I am aware there is a tablet/phone app (not available for my Android or iOS devices according to the intro video) but that just take make it feasible yet painful.
author: robdew

review: 40 dollars for this or 69 for the Amazon Fire TV on cyber Monday.  I would rather have a device that can allow you to plug in a hardwire network cable instead of only have wifi as an option.  We had issues trying to get it to work on the hotel wifi, because of the login procedure you need to follow to get onto Hotel wifi networks.  Compared to the Amazon Fire TV where you can plug into the back of the device a network cable which bypasses the hotel internet setup.
author: MyReviewMyStory

review: This is so worth the wait and the money! Fast and no issues with streaming so far.
